title: Client Window Size
body: I been using the macbook for league of legends. The beta and alpha client window size was too big, but then it gave me a option to make it smaller. Then the client became too small and i can't adjust it back to the bigger client. I tried the instructions in other forums like crtl + or crtl - but I don't think that applies to the mac. Is there any solution? Thank you! Can a rioter please respond Targon blade ignore me and deleted my question in another forum :(.

replies.body:
Ohai, let's get this issue resolved!


The **CTRL +** or **CTRL -** methods do work for the Mac Client, just be sure the client has been selected (click on anything inside the client) before trying to hotkeys. If this doesn't work, you can hop into the settings using the cog icon near the X at the top of the client and change the *window size* using the dropdown menu before hitting **DONE**.

I hope this helped, let me know if you have any other issues.

Thank you for verifying with crtl + and crtl -. However, I follow the instructions and it still didn't change. I tried command + and - and then push control + and - while selected in the league client. Using the cog icon, I don't have any options besides 1024 * 576. I really appreciate your help ,but nothing is working so far. Thanks!

Which specific Mac are you running? You may need to [adjust your display resolution](https://support.apple.com/kb/PH19043?locale=en_US) in order to have the Beta Client give you more scaling options.

Let me know~
Im Running a Mac Pro early 2015. Im not sure where is the display resolution. I check it out !
